subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] QS news update
msgSnippet: While this new QS news program is a great idea and a good way to improve reading, I m wondering where the original text is coming from.  If it s just from
messageBody:
While this new QS news program is a great idea and a good way to improve reading, I'm wondering where the original text is coming from.  If it's just from standard news sites, most likely the text is under copyright, and shouldn't be used.  If that's the case, perhaps you could consider using something like Wikinews ( en.wikinews.org), which is published under a Creative Commons license.
   Just want to make sure everything's legal!  Thanks for your work, Paul.

-Benjamin Bruce


2007/11/13, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...>:

I have worked on making better PDF news documents.

1. The web junk (a page of just links, for example) should not appear
anymore.

2. I have fixed the conversion so that it puts in name dots. However,
the conversion now puts in too many such dots. The problem is that I put
a name dot for every capitalized word that does not start a sentence.
(Sometimes the conversion doesn't recognize the start of a sentence,
such as after a title.) This means words like "Tuesday" gets
capitalized. In order to fix this problem, I have to change my 100,000
word dictionary so that words like 'chavez" gets changed to "Chavez,"
but given the enormous size of the dictionary, I can't change very many
names. So we either have to have too many dots, or not enough, at least
until we get a better dictionary.

Paul




--
